remarks: It suffices to consider functions which are not defined at ` B ` to define the limit of a function.  In particular, the value of the original function ` F ` at ` B ` does not affect the limit of ` F ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Dec-2016.)
statement:
limccl.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> CC ) $.
limcdif $p |- ( ph -> ( F limCC B ) = ( ( F |` ( A \ { B } ) ) limCC B ) ) $.
